data.title: Allow to disable textual completion prosals for an position or language
data.body:
At the moment when none of the contributed completion processors returns any proposals, the textual completion processor starts adding proposals.
That's fine for languages where we have no sophisticated completion processor, but looks bad for languages that pretend to have a 'smart' completion processor.

data.title: Mac with german locale: Not showing german NLS
data.body: I have set my Mac to german and the OS shows me things in german but starting Code does not show german strings (works when passing in --locale).

data.title: Make it clear how to cancel a running search
data.body:
Did some research, hope it is not duplicate... Is there functionality (some shortcut maybe?) to break searching? Because when you develop a project, you often need to search stuff across all files. No problem here, until you actually have project with like many many files. For example, if you have project where node_modules are not ignored in search (since even there you sometimes need to search stuff) or you have some internal directory with internal builds, you get like too many results and you are not able to break search to specify search more closely or to just get rid of searching. Usually ends up with crash of vscode... 

Version 0.10.6 (0.10.6)

data.title: Cannot invoke actions in quick open entries with keyboard
data.body: Still need to make sure that clicking an action with the mouse inside a quick open entry, does not close quick open (e.g. install an extension).

data.title: Extensions quick open: Can no longer click into installing extension without quick open closing
Focus border in find input should contain also the toggle buttons
Improve Intellisense perf
data.body:
This is my setup
- have brutalo language that suggests 20K random items (item labels are numbers)
- in an empty document trigger intellisense three times to warm up
- start CPU profiler
- hit ctrl+space, and when IntelliSense has loaded hit ESC

I have attached the trace, I see signs of _death by thousand paper cuts_ in the tree-internals
- opening the widget ~35%
- closing the widget take ~19%

That closing takes so long is concerning - there no obvious bottle necks but a lot of klein-klein which I hope we can tackle. Also the marshalling takes ~8% which we can improve. And last but not least ~16% GC'ing which is also a bad sign

data.title: Focus tracking with 2 markdown previews is broken
data.body:
- Open two markdown previews side by side
- The top editor actions are always displayed in one editor, no matter which preview has focus
- I would expect the focused editor to show the actions (so I can go back to editing my markdown and so on)

data.title: Variables when used inside launch.json args not updating
Can't pull/push/fetch in TurtoiseGit with VSC opened
data.body:
It looks like new version of VSC is creating index.lock in .git directory when doing any "actions", such as pull/push/fetch using TurtoiseGit. When i close VSC, no problem. Problem appears even with disabled git and autofetch (`"git.enabled": false,"git.autofetch": false,`)

it looks VSC related, since it does only with opened editor
- it doesnt do always, cant really tell whats reason of throwing index.lock file + it creates it only when doing actual pull/push/fetch and it dissapears after throwing "index.lock exists" error

data.title: Not using standard landmarks
data.body: See http://webaim.org/techniques/aria/

data.title: Intellisense not working properly with bound functions
data.body:
In general intellisense works just fine, see the following trivial example:
![good](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/464954/12641927/deaa630e-c5b2-11e5-9883-3cb843e72e4b.png)]
Intellisense suggests both the 2 members of "this", as expected.

However when using a bound function, the handler of the setTimeout method in this case, intellisense is unable to scope "this" to the class. It suggests nothing:
![bad](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/464954/12642068/caa24358-c5b3-11e5-9841-b9801fb8ef77.png)

We can give a hint to intellisense, afterwards it comes up with the correct suggestion:
![afterhelp](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/464954/12642086/e7d0af8c-c5b3-11e5-8fa3-f8738dd4d75e.png)

The real issue is when refactoring, find all references does not properly work:
![references](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/464954/12642137/2a2acbb0-c5b4-11e5-859f-1efce1dc0448.png)

data.title: Visual Studio Code & node.js: Debugger exits without error message on "utils.format"
data.body:
Node 5.3, VS Code 0.10.6, Windows 8.1
- node.js application logging debug output to the console.
- Running it as "node myApp.js" works fine: The app runs and all the "console.log" statements are correctly printed to  stdout resp. stderr. 
- Running it as "node debug myApp.js" worsk fine, too.
- When I launch the same "myApp.js" in VS Code, the debuger exits (shuts down the app) on the first "console.log('Logging a complex object: %O', myComplexObject)". It does not print any error messages.
- Narrowing down the error, I found out that "util.format()" with a complex object causes the problem, not the logging itself.

data.title: Wiki how to contribute unit test section is out of date
data.body: [The page](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#unit-testing) refers to a `test/run.sh` script which does not exist. The real script is `scripts/test.sh` as mentioned in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/test/README.md

data.title: Contributors cannot edit the wiki (or it's unclear how to)
data.body:
I can clone the wiki, as far as I'm aware though [GitHub does not support PRs for wiki repos](http://stackoverflow.com/a/11481887/1156119).

Related https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/414, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/556

data.title: Support for middle click to paste selection on Linux
data.body:
I hope to make this PR eventually fix #110. Currently it inserts the selection from the clipboard on Linux at the current cursor position. The following needs to be done to the PR:
- [ ] Do it the proper way (should this live in `codeEditorWidget.ts`?)
- [ ] Update the cursor to be under the mouse (emit some event that's picked up by `MouseHandler`?)
- [ ] Clear the selection after pasting
- [ ] Add tests if possible

Any advice on the first two points by people familiar with the code would be greatly appreciated.
